result.execSummary:
The defendant Alexander Ian Siniard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine of $1,200.00 plus costs, surcharges and fees.  To be taken out of bail on deposit.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to 15CF512.
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program/Wisconsin Substance Abuse Programs.  The court is to be notified after 30 days of completion.  Once Court is notified and approval granted, defendant can be released and remaining incarceration balance can be added to Extended Supervision time.

superMiscConds.notes: Inform any and all medical personnel of drug addiction.
AODA assessment, treatment if needed.  Absolute sobriety.  Urine screens to ensure compliance.  No controlled substances or alcohol.

supervisions.notes: To commence upon eligibility to reinstate license.
Court Order for IDP Related Offense Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Program signed and filed.

Court advised   defendant he will have to provide a DNA sample to the  Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing, pay DNA surcharge.
Court advised defendant  that as a convited felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms; and that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

records.addlTxt: Signed Earned Release Program/Substance Abuse Program Order mailed to Racine Correctional Institution 2019 Wisconsin St. Sturtevant, WI 53177-1829 .

- signed and filed.  

IT IS ORDERED that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision.  The number of days that are converted from Confinement Time to Extended Supervision will be determined by Department of Corrections Records Office staff member and will be based upon actual release date. 

IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the prisoner is assigned shall effect the defendant's release within 6 working days upon receipt of this order.
DOC is requesting the Court to authorize the inmate's release and conversion of remaining confinement time to extended supervision.  Assigned to Br. 18 Judge Colon
